DOC.detailed_description: The Policy & Research Group ( PRG ) evaluate Safer Sex Intervention ( SSI ) . The Safer Sex Intervention base Social Cognitive Theory , Transtheoretical Model Behavior Change , motivational interviewing . Coupled skill-building exercise , intervention intend increase knowledge relate risk safe-sex behavior , increase awareness risk need behavior change , help build self-efficacy engage safe-sex behavior , , ultimately , motivate participant engage maintain safe sex practice . The intervention mean deliver four , one-on-one session course six month . Each session conduct private set female health educator train motivational interviewing Safer Sex Intervention . The initial primary intervention session take approximately 30 50 minute . Subsequent `` booster session '' deliver 1 , 3 , 6 month follow initial session take 10 30 minute . Booster session intend sustain result behavior change . The control ( counterfactual ) condition , Female Sexual Health , develop specifically use study ; consist 30-minute PowerPoint presentation , intend deliver one face-to-face session provide information reproductive anatomy STIs . After presentation , participant receive free condom . This session control condition ; booster session . Though variation consent requirement across site , difference recruitment process treatment control group . All eligible individual provide proper consent participate randomize enrolled study time attend first schedule study session . Data collect via self-administered questionnaire schedule baseline six month post treatment ( 12 month baseline ) . The study take place New Orleans , Louisiana , five clinic serve young woman age 14 19 .
